title: Badwater Basin Ranger Talk
description: Visit an extreme part of the park and learn about the unique forces that create the lowest, hottest and driest place in North America.

images.altText: People walking on white salt flats on a valley floor with mountains and clouds in the distance
images.caption: Explore Badwater Basin with a ranger

title: Golden Canyon Ranger-led Hike
description: Hike with a ranger through one of Death Valley’s most popular and beautiful canyons. Easy walk with one small scramble. Approximately 1 mile. Bring water, a hat and hiking shoes.
location: Meet at the Golden Canyon Trailhead Parking Lot

images.altText: Image looking up a gravel wash through a canyon with golden yellow and brown towering walls.
images.caption: Explore Death Valley's most popular trail with a ranger.

title: Harmony Borax Works Ranger Program
description: Learn about fascinating mining history in Death Valley. 20 mule team wagons, borax, fortunes and more! Easy 1/3 mile walk on a paved path.
location: Meet at Harmony Borax Works Parking Area

images.altText: Close up image of two large wooden wagons with rusted metal wheels.
images.caption: Discover the history of 20 mule team wagons

title: History of Stovepipe Wells
description: Discover the history and unique landscape of the Stovepipe Wells area. Rangers will be available from 10am-12pm to answer questions in addition to program times.

images.altText: A ranger station with a raised flag in front of a blue sky
images.caption: Stovepipe Ranger Station

title: Junior Ranger Ceremony
description: Be sworn in as an offical Death Valley Junior Ranger! Bring a completed Junior Ranger Book to earn a badge.

images.altText: A ranger and two junior rangers pose with newly aquired badges.
images.caption: Junior Ranger Ceremony

title: Sand Dunes Ranger Walk
description: Stroll through the Death Valley Wilderness with a Park Ranger. Explore living and non-living parts of this unique landscape.
location: Meet at the Mesquite Flat Sand Dunes Parking Lot

images.altText: Yellow sand dunes with dark shadows and mountains in the background.
images.caption: Explore Mesquite Flat Sand Dunes at Sunset with a Death Valley ranger.

title: Indoor Evening Ranger Talk
description: Bring the whole family to enjoy a “Ranger’s Choice” presentation from the comfort of indoor auditorium seating. Ask at the visitor center for the topic.

images.altText: Profile silhouette of a presenter in front of a colorful nebula on a projector screen
images.caption: Join an evening program for a "Ranger's Choice" presentation.
